title: E-Commerce Vouchers - Enhancements
text: Voucher Redemptions: Add a feature for setting template ID for vouchers. This will be on the Voucher, with additional options for retail and adoptions as neither will have a template ID. If it isn’t in the list the voucher will not be allowed. Text will be amended with a generic message. Replacing the current “Invalid Voucher” with text suggesting trying again, if still fails, call a number. Note: - It is known if a basket contains multiple types of ticket, it won’t handle every possibility. For example, Membership first, then and event, we store the membership page ID as such if they attempt to use an event voucher it will not allow and suggest try again/call. Importantly these exceptions will result in them needing to call rather than allowing the wrong vouchers.
description:
Voucher Redemptions:

 

  • Add a feature for setting template ID for vouchers. This will be on the Voucher, with additional options for retail and adoptions as neither will have a template ID.

  • If it isn’t in the list the voucher will not be allowed.

  • Text will be amended with a generic message. Replacing the current “Invalid Voucher” with text suggesting trying again, if still fails, call a number.



 

Note: - It is known if a basket contains multiple types of ticket, it won’t handle every possibility. For example, Membership first, then and event, we store the membership page ID as such if they attempt to use an event voucher it will not allow and suggest try again/call. Importantly these exceptions will result in them needing to call rather than allowing the wrong vouchers.

title: Digital Wallets
text: This feature enables Google and Apple Wallet pages to be used with our e-commerce ticketing. Websites will need to undergo enhancements to have this feature added. It can be applied to V1 and V1.5 Websites. One it has been added there will be two options within the website admin config. Each of the options will allow the customer to change the pictures that are passed to the wallets data. We would expect customers to change the descriptions but not the values pulled from our system. We have created the options to make it easier and more Customisable as customers require changes. For a customer to start receiving these passes as part of the email they receive. The emails can be modified to with two new merge fields. If they do not want the passes to be available on certain types of bookings. This can be done by not including them in the email template the customer receives. We have written an API to allow the passing of this information for all our customers to a single point and using our certificates. With this in place, the customer configuration involvement is minimal. Examples: Booking reference along the top as normal. If the customer uses unique tickets and the merge tag is on the email and this feature is turned on with the merge tag on the email. It will show a a digital wallet option for the individual ticket. This allow entry or validation on a per ticket basis. The code being sent is the unique ticket reference. There is an option at the bottom to add a digital wallet for the whole booking. The QR Code that is associated with the pass will be the booking reference. If using unique tickets the pass shows the ticket info and individual quantity. The total quantity is shown which in this case indicates 1/2 tickets. If using the booking reference, there will be no ticket information, no quantity. The total Qty is shown for the number of booked items. The code is the booking reference. Key important information in this summary view is the date, template description, the total quantity, the time and the booking reference. The time is that of when they are intending to arrive or if they use general timeslots for all day. It is suggested "Time" be changed to "Opening Time" or similar in the options listed above. Digital Wallets for Memberships: Configuration for memberships is separate to bookings. The descriptions can be modified, for example some of our customers would prefer annual pass type or holder name etc. The email template will need to use the merge tag: It is a standard tag to show details of each membership on screen separately. If the tag is present and the site is using digital wallets the attachments for memberships (apple) or the google wallet option will appear. Key points to note: 1) In my screenshots above it only shows Google Wallet, that is because the screens were taken on an android device. If on an apple device it apple pass attachments as part of the email they receive. 2) This is not intended to show price, be a receipt or be a breakdown of an itinerary. It is PASS. 3) Digital Wallets for memberships extend current functionality and doesn't change it. Temporary card numbers, real card numbers will depend on their onsite configurations. This just extends the card numbers will have already received to their digital wallets. Finer points of card numbers is outside the scope of this work and is just standard setup advice.
description:
This feature enables Google and Apple Wallet pages to be used with our e-commerce ticketing.

Websites will need to undergo enhancements to have this feature added. It can be applied to V1 and V1.5 Websites.

One it has been added there will be two options within the website admin config.




Each of the options will allow the customer to change the pictures that are passed to the wallets data.

We would expect customers to change the descriptions but not the values pulled from our system. We have created the options to make it easier and more Customisable as customers require changes. 






For a customer to start receiving these passes as part of the email they receive. The emails can be modified to with two new merge fields.

<p><merge.googlepass/></p>

<p><merge.applepass/></p>






If they do not want the passes to be available on certain types of bookings. This can be done by not including them in the email template the customer receives.

We have written an API to allow the passing of this information for all our customers to a single point and using our certificates. With this in place, the customer configuration involvement is minimal.


Examples:

Booking reference along the top as normal. 





If the customer uses unique tickets and the merge tag is on the email and this feature is turned on with the merge tag on the email. It will show a a digital wallet option for the individual ticket. This allow entry or validation on a per ticket basis. The code being sent is the unique ticket reference. 




There is an option at the bottom to add a digital wallet for the whole booking. The QR Code that is associated with the pass will be the booking reference. 







If using unique tickets the pass shows the ticket info and individual quantity. The total quantity is shown which in this case indicates 1/2 tickets. 

 






If using the booking reference, there will be no ticket information, no quantity. The total Qty is shown for the number of booked items. The code is the booking reference. Key important information in this summary view is the date, template description, the total quantity, the time and the booking reference.

The time is that of when they are intending to arrive or if they use general timeslots for all day. It is suggested "Time" be changed to "Opening Time" or similar in the options listed above. 





Digital Wallets for Memberships:


Configuration for memberships is separate to bookings. The descriptions can be modified, for example some of our customers would prefer annual pass type or holder name etc.



 




The email template will need to use the merge tag: <MERGE.MEMBERCARDS/>


It is a standard tag to show details of each membership on screen separately. If the tag is present and the site is using digital wallets the attachments for memberships (apple) or the google wallet option will appear. 








Key points to note:

1) In my screenshots above it only shows Google Wallet, that is because the screens were taken on an android device. If on an apple device it apple pass attachments as part of the email they receive.

2) This is not intended to show price, be a receipt or be a breakdown of an itinerary. It is  PASS.
3) Digital Wallets for memberships extend current functionality and doesn't change it. Temporary card numbers, real card numbers will depend on their onsite configurations. This just extends the card numbers will have already received to their digital wallets. Finer points of card numbers is outside the scope of this work and is just standard setup advice.

title: Session Images Filter
text: There is a new template filter. Filters only work on sessions. The new filter is called “Session Images”. This will activate a new sessionsFIP page. This would need to be built in a customer website along with the ability to add images to session types. If filter is not set, it will load a normal sessions page. The website will detect this filter and change the page by itself. New option within the admin page online. Upload images and assign images to session types. It will show as the image, any blurb and as options, then an accordion to see times. Each session type will show with image and blurb and will hide the times until chosen, once time is chosen, tickets can be selected.
description:
There is a new template filter. Filters only work on sessions. The new filter is called “Session Images”.  



This will activate a new sessionsFIP page. This would need to be built in a customer website along with the ability to add images to session types. If filter is not set, it will load a normal sessions page. The website will detect this filter and change the page by itself. 

New option within the admin page online.



Upload images and assign images to session types. 








It will show as the image, any blurb and as options, then an accordion to see times. 





Each session type will show with image and blurb and will hide the times until chosen, once time is chosen, tickets can be selected.

title: Apportion capacity without seating plan
text: Enhancements have been made to allow apportioning of capacity with price bands without needing a seating plan. Example below: For this to work, enhancements are needing to be made on the customers website, web DB script updated, version 3.19.15 or above, the latest MOI dated May 2025 onwards and version 1.5 of the website. Example of the messaging: This has since been extended to show the price band name within the messaging if required.
description:
Enhancements have been made to allow apportioning of capacity with price bands without needing a seating plan.

Example below:



For this to work, enhancements are needing to be made on the customers website, web DB script updated, version 3.19.15 or above, the latest MOI dated May 2025 onwards and version 1.5 of the website.

Example of the messaging:


This has since been extended to show the price band name within the messaging if required.

title: Booking fee percentage
text: In the config options you will see 3 more settings. Booking Fee TIDS - Select the template it relates to. Any Template ID it finds throughout the buying process will trigger this to turning on. Even if using a follow on template, if any TID is in this list it will activate. Booking Fee resource is set using the ID as found below. Booking fee percentage is the % of the total booking. It will only include session able items in the total when working out the percentage. It will be recalculated if adding more tickets. It will show in the basket as the description of the resource given. The item cannot be removed.
description:
In the config options you will see 3 more settings.

Booking Fee TIDS - Select the template it relates to. Any Template ID it finds throughout the buying process will trigger this to turning on. Even if using a follow on template, if any TID is in this list it will activate.



Booking Fee resource is set using the ID as found below. 





Booking fee percentage is the % of the total booking. It will only include session able items in the total when working out the percentage. It will be recalculated if adding more tickets. 



It will show in the basket as the description of the resource given. The item cannot be removed.

title: CSS Styling toggle
text: New Lookup is now available. That can be set on template header. By having the template style added to the template header. It will change the link. That will trigger the website to use the corresponding website design. In our test environment we demonstrated that small changes reflect it is showing different when setting is ticked. It is also possible for K3 to add a style design our side as requested and it back updates the lookups via API ready for the customer to choose on the template header. This allows the customer to create them in advance and tell us the CSS they want building for the website, or we (K3) add a new website design and name it which flows down to your system ready to set. This requires v1.5, feature enhancement, and 3.15.19 onwards.
description:
New Lookup is now available. 

 

 

 

That can be set on template header.




By having the template style added to the template header. It will change the link. 


 That will trigger the website to use the corresponding website design. In our test environment we demonstrated that small changes reflect it is showing different when setting is ticked. 

 


It is also possible for K3 to add a style design our side as requested and it back updates the lookups via API ready for the customer to choose on the template header. This allows the customer to create them in advance and tell us the CSS they want building for the website, or we (K3) add a new website design and name it which flows down to your system ready to set.

This requires v1.5, feature enhancement, and 3.15.19 onwards.

title: Member Visit Restrictions
text: Available in 3.19.16 New Visit Restrictions button that allowed you to set total number of visits per set of session types and the date ranges. When the membership card is scanned on the POS with the session selected it will perform checks. If they don’t have enough visits remaining it will prevent them from proceeding. Online with member validation in place it will do similar checks. Note that that we perform checks to ensure if a card has been used in the basket, we take that in to account to when checking the database. A web config prevents it from being used twice however if that is not set and cards can be used more than once, this will take it in to account.
description:
Available in 3.19.16


New Visit Restrictions button that allowed you to set total number of visits per set of session types and the date ranges.






When the membership card is scanned on the POS with the session selected it will perform checks. If they don’t have enough visits remaining it will prevent them from proceeding.



Online with member validation in place it will do similar checks. Note that that we perform checks to ensure if a card has been used in the basket, we take that in to account to when checking the database. A web config prevents it from being used twice however if that is not set and cards can be used more than once, this will take it in to account.

title: Version 3.19.16 - Session Dependency Link (Online)
text: To book session A you need book something in session B...C...D.... List of all active session types multi select. OR rule rather than AND. At the basket stage. If a session type has been chosen which has a link dependency set. Checks if another item in the basket linked to once of the sessions in the dependency. If yes, then pass and allow to continue without messaging. If fails > message that states they must purchase a X,Y,Z session type ticket. DO NOT ALLOW to continue. Within Session types. Choose the session type that needs to have something sold alongside. Last year they used “Santa 2024” and this year it will either be renamed or new ones setup. Click > “Dependency Link” Choose the session type that needs to be sold in order to buy the session type selected.
description:
To book session A you need book something in session B...C...D....

List of all active session types multi select. OR rule rather than AND.

At the basket stage. If a session type has been chosen which has a link dependency set. Checks if another item in the basket linked to once of the sessions in the dependency. If yes, then pass and allow to continue without messaging. If fails > message that states they must purchase a X,Y,Z session type ticket. DO NOT ALLOW to continue.

Within Session types. Choose the session type that needs to have something sold alongside. 

Last year they used “Santa 2024” and this year it will either be renamed or new ones setup.

Click > “Dependency Link”



Choose the session type that needs to be sold in order to buy the session type selected.
